shared

Class FileHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.FileHelper

  • public class FileHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Shared methods to help with file I/O Operations. Deals with reads and writes and is able to do file manipulation like creation and permission checking.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void createFile(java.io.File file)
      Creates a new text file if it doesn't already exist.
      static void createSubDirectories(java.lang.String path)
      Method that will create the sub directories in a path from the running directory of the program.
      static java.io.File getFileFromPacket(java.net.DatagramPacket initialPacket)
      Retrieves the file from the data packet and parses it to get the file name.
      static boolean hasPermission(java.io.File file, java.lang.String perm)
      Checks the file has the permission passed.
      static byte[] parseFile(int blockNumber, java.lang.String location, java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
      Parses the file by blocks using the block number given where each block holds 512 bytes.
      static void writeFile(java.lang.String data, java.io.File file)
      File write method for the client side read that will write to the string contents passed to the file in append mode so that no data is overwritten.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • hasPermission

        public static boolean hasPermission(java.io.File file,
                    java.lang.String perm)
        Checks the file has the permission passed.
        Parameters:
        file - File to check permissions on
        perm - String representing permission i.e. "read", "write"
        Returns:
        true if file has permissions, false otherwise

      • parseFile

        public static byte[] parseFile(int blockNumber,
               java.lang.String location,
               java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Parses the file by blocks using the block number given where each block holds 512 bytes. Reads one block at a time. Synchronized method so that only one thread can access the system resource.
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - Block number to read from where 1 represents the first block in the file (byte 0)
        location - path to the file on the system
        charset - Character encoding to use for the read
        Returns:
        returns the byte array (size 512) that holds the block parsed from the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is a problem accessing the file
        java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if the file is not readable

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(java.lang.String data,
             java.io.File file)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        File write method for the client side read that will write to the string contents passed to the file in append mode so that no data is overwritten.
        Parameters:
        data - Data to write to file
        file - File to append data into
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createFile

        public static void createFile(java.io.File file)
                       throws ExistsException
        Creates a new text file if it doesn't already exist. If the file already exists an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        file - file to check if it exists
        Throws:
        ExistsException - thrown if file already exists
        java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if the file could not be created

      • getFileFromPacket

        public static java.io.File getFileFromPacket(java.net.DatagramPacket initialPacket)
        Retrieves the file from the data packet and parses it to get the file name.
        Returns:
        Returns the file corresponding to the client request

      • createSubDirectories

        public static void createSubDirectories(java.lang.String path)
        Method that will create the sub directories in a path from the running directory of the program. Strips the file name away from the path and creates the rest of the path as directories.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to save file under the root where the project is being run
